1.english: The book of the genealogy of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham.
1.wedau: [book] ana  [genealogy] ana Yesu Keriso  natuna ana David  natuna ana Abraham
1.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.73); Strong secondary: Love

2.english: Abraham became the father of Isaac. Isaac became the father of Jacob. Jacob became the father of Judah and his brothers.
2.wedau: Abraham [became]  Tamatei ana [isaac] [isaac] [became]  Tamatei ana Jacob Jacob [became]  Tamatei ana [judah] ma ana tevera

3.english: Judah became the father of Perez and Zerah by Tamar. Perez became the father of Hezron. Hezron became the father of Ram.
3.wedau: [judah] [became]  Tamatei ana [perez] ma [zerah] au [tamar] [perez] [became]  Tamatei ana [hezron] [hezron] [became]  Tamatei ana [ram]

4.english: Ram became the father of Amminadab. Amminadab became the father of Nahshon. Nahshon became the father of Salmon.
4.wedau: [ram] [became]  Tamatei ana [amminadab] [amminadab] [became]  Tamatei ana [nahshon] [nahshon] [became]  Tamatei ana [salmon]

5.english: Salmon became the father of Boaz by Rahab. Boaz became the father of Obed by Ruth. Obed became the father of Jesse.
5.wedau: [salmon] [became]  Tamatei ana [boaz] au [rahab] [boaz] [became]  Tamatei ana [obed] au [ruth] [obed] [became]  Tamatei ana [jesse]

6.english: Jesse became the father of King David. David became the father of Solomon by her who had been Uriah’s wife.
6.wedau: [jesse] [became]  Tamatei ana kingi David David [became]  Tamatei ana [solomon] au ana aiyai ana  [uriah’s] [wife]

7.english: Solomon became the father of Rehoboam. Rehoboam became the father of Abijah. Abijah became the father of Asa.
7.wedau: [solomon] [became]  Tamatei ana [rehoboam] [rehoboam] [became]  Tamatei ana [abijah] [abijah] [became]  Tamatei ana [asa]

8.english: Asa became the father of Jehoshaphat. Jehoshaphat became the father of Joram. Joram became the father of Uzziah.
8.wedau: [asa] [became]  Tamatei ana [jehoshaphat] [jehoshaphat] [became]  Tamatei ana [joram] [joram] [became]  Tamatei ana [uzziah]

9.english: Uzziah became the father of Jotham. Jotham became the father of Ahaz. Ahaz became the father of Hezekiah.
9.wedau: [uzziah] [became]  Tamatei ana [jotham] [jotham] [became]  Tamatei ana [ahaz] [ahaz] [became]  Tamatei ana [hezekiah]

10.english: Hezekiah became the father of Manasseh. Manasseh became the father of Amon. Amon became the father of Josiah.
10.wedau: [hezekiah] [became]  Tamatei ana [manasseh] [manasseh] [became]  Tamatei ana [amon] [amon] [became]  Tamatei ana [josiah]

11.english: Josiah became the father of Jechoniah and his brothers, at the time of the exile to Babylon.
11.wedau: [josiah] [became]  Tamatei ana [jechoniah] ma ana tevera au  mara ana  [exile] da [babylon]

12.english: After the exile to Babylon, Jechoniah became the father of Shealtiel. Shealtiel became the father of Zerubbabel.
12.wedau: muriyai  [exile] da [babylon] [jechoniah] [became]  Tamatei ana [shealtiel] [shealtiel] [became]  Tamatei ana [zerubbabel]

13.english: Zerubbabel became the father of Abiud. Abiud became the father of Eliakim. Eliakim became the father of Azor.
13.wedau: [zerubbabel] [became]  Tamatei ana [abiud] [abiud] [became]  Tamatei ana [eliakim] [eliakim] [became]  Tamatei ana [azor]

14.english: Azor became the father of Zadok. Zadok became the father of Achim. Achim became the father of Eliud.
14.wedau: [azor] [became]  Tamatei ana [zadok] [zadok] [became]  Tamatei ana [achim] [achim] [became]  Tamatei ana [eliud]

15.english: Eliud became the father of Eleazar. Eleazar became the father of Matthan. Matthan became the father of Jacob.
15.wedau: [eliud] [became]  Tamatei ana [eleazar] [eleazar] [became]  Tamatei ana [matthan] [matthan] [became]  Tamatei ana Jacob

16.english: Jacob became the father of Joseph, the husband of Mary, from whom was born Jesus, who is called Christ.
16.wedau: Jacob [became]  Tamatei ana Joseph  [husband] ana Mary au aiyai  [born] Yesu aiyai  ghorehi Keriso
16.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.73); Strong secondary: Love

17.english: So all the generations from Abraham to David are fourteen generations; from David to the exile to Babylon fourteen generations; and from the carrying away to Babylon to the Christ, fourteen generations.
17.wedau: yamna anatapuhi  [generations] au Abraham da David  [fourteen] [generations;] au David da  [exile] da [babylon] [fourteen] [generations;] ma au  [carrying] [away] da [babylon] da  Keriso [fourteen] [generations]

18.english: Now the birth of Jesus Christ was like this: After his mother, Mary, was engaged to Joseph, before they came together, she was found pregnant by the Holy Spirit.
18.wedau: ina marana  [birth] ana Yesu Keriso  [like] [this:] muriyai ana hinana Mary  [engaged] da Joseph naona tauhi neꞌi [together] tauna  tuhaghai [pregnant] au  [holy] aruwa
18.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.91); Strong secondary: Love

19.english: Joseph, her husband, being a righteous man, and not willing to make her a public example, intended to put her away secretly.
19.wedau: Joseph ana [husband]   [righteous] oroto ma egha ghohaghohana da rura ana  [public] [example] [intended] da terei ana [away] [secretly]
19.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Justice (0.74); Strong secondary: Wisdom

20.english: But when he thought about these things, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream, saying, “Joseph, son of David, don’t be afraid to take to yourself Mary, your wife, for that which is conceived in her is of the Holy Spirit.
20.wedau: tuna maranaina tauna [thought] awarina ina [things] [behold] [an] [angel] ana  Guyau [appeared] da tauna au  [dream] riwa ipa [“joseph] natuna ana David [don’t]  [afraid] da varahai da [yourself] Mary ami [wife] yamna raketana aiyai  [conceived] au ana  ana  [holy] aruwa
20.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.89); Strong secondary: Love

21.english: She shall give birth to a son. You shall name him Jesus, for it is he who shall save his people from their sins.”
21.wedau: tauna ina verei [birth] da  natuna omi ina wava tauna Yesu yamna tauna  tauna aiyai ina [save] ana rava au ahi [sins”]
21.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.70); Strong secondary: Love

22.english: Now all this has happened that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Lord through the prophet, saying,
22.wedau: ina marana anatapuhi ina ana [happened] raketana tauna ita  ririweiya aiyai  [spoken] au  Guyau au  peroveta riwa ipa
22.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.70); Strong secondary: Love

23.english: “Behold, the virgin shall be with child, and shall give birth to a son. They shall call his name Immanuel;” which is, being interpreted, “God with us.”
23.wedau: [“behold]  [virgin] ina  maitehi ghoraghora ma ina verei [birth] da  natuna tauhi ina ghorehi ana wava [immanuel;”] aiyai   [interpreted] [“god] maitehi [us”]

24.english: Joseph arose from his sleep, and did as the angel of the Lord commanded him, and took his wife to himself;
24.wedau: Joseph [arose] au ana [sleep] ma rura   [angel] ana  Guyau ririweiya tauna ma varahai ana [wife] da [himself;]

25.english: and didn’t know her sexually until she had given birth to her firstborn son. He named him Jesus.
25.wedau: ma [didn’t] haramaneꞌi ana [sexually] [until] tauna ana verei [birth] da ana [firstborn] natuna tauna [named] tauna Yesu
25.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.71); Strong secondary: Love

1.english: Now when Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judea in the days of King Herod, behold, wise men from the east came to Jerusalem, saying,
1.wedau: ina marana maranaina Yesu  [born] au [bethlehem] ana judiya au  maratom ana kingi [herod] [behold] [wise] rava au  [east] neꞌi da jerusalem riwa ipa
1.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.81); Strong secondary: Love

2.english: “Where is he who is born King of the Jews? For we saw his star in the east, and have come to worship him.”
2.wedau: [“where]  tauna aiyai  [born] kingi ana  [jews?] yamna ita inana ana [star] au  [east] ma ana neꞌi da [worship] [him”]

3.english: When King Herod heard it, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him.
3.wedau: maranaina kingi [herod] [heard] tauna tauna  [troubled] ma anatapuhi jerusalem maitehi tauna

4.english: Gathering together all the chief priests and scribes of the people, he asked them where the Christ would be born.
4.wedau: [gathering] [together] anatapuhi  [chief] pirisina ma tauviharaharamanahi ana  rava tauna rau-baghei hita aiwaꞌi  Keriso ina  [born]

5.english: They said to him, “In Bethlehem of Judea, for this is written through the prophet,
5.wedau: tauhi riwa da tauna [“in] [bethlehem] ana judiya yamna ina  [written] au  peroveta

6.english: ‘You Bethlehem, land of Judah, are in no way least among the princes of Judah: for out of you shall come a governor, who shall shepherd my people, Israel.’ ”
6.wedau: [‘you] [bethlehem] [land] ana [judah]  au egha parata [least] [among]  [princes] ana [judah:] yamna hopu ana omi ina neꞌi  [governor] aiyai ina [shepherd] au rava [israel’] [”]

7.english: Then Herod secretly called the wise men, and learned from them exactly what time the star appeared.
7.wedau: maratagogi [herod] [secretly] ghorehi  [wise] rava ma [learned] au hita [exactly] aiwaꞌi mara  [star] [appeared]

8.english: He sent them to Bethlehem, and said, “Go and search diligently for the young child. When you have found him, bring me word, so that I also may come and worship him.”
8.wedau: tauna vivohi hita da [bethlehem] ma riwa [“go] ma [search] [diligently] yamna  [young] ghoraghora maranaina omi ana tuhaghai tauna [bring] tau riwana yamna raketana tau maitehi ita neꞌi ma [worship] [him”]

9.english: They, having heard the king, went their way; and behold, the star, which they saw in the east, went before them, until it came and stood over where the young child was.
9.wedau: tauhi [having] [heard]  kingi nae ahi [way;] ma [behold]  [star] aiyai tauhi inana au  [east] nae naona hita [until] tauna neꞌi ma [stood] au aiwaꞌi  [young] ghoraghora

10.english: When they saw the star, they rejoiced with exceedingly great joy.
10.wedau: maranaina tauhi inana  [star] tauhi [rejoiced] maitehi [exceedingly] ghe vavahagha [joy]

11.english: They came into the house and saw the young child with Mary, his mother, and they fell down and worshiped him. Opening their treasures, they offered to him gifts: gold, frankincense, and myrrh.
11.wedau: tauhi neꞌi au  numa ma inana  [young] ghoraghora maitehi Mary ana hinana ma tauhi [fell] au ma [worshiped] tauna [opening] ahi [treasures] tauhi [offered] da tauna [gifts:] [gold] [frankincense] ma [myrrh]

12.english: Being warned in a dream not to return to Herod, they went back to their own country another way.
12.wedau: [warned] au  [dream] egha da [return] da [herod] tauhi nae [back] da ahi ana [country] [another] parata

13.english: Now when they had departed, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream, saying, “Arise and take the young child and his mother, and flee into Egypt, and stay there until I tell you, for Herod will seek the young child to destroy him.”

14.english: He arose and took the young child and his mother by night, and departed into Egypt,

15.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.70); Strong secondary: Love

16.english: Then Herod, when he saw that he was mocked by the wise men, was exceedingly angry, and sent out, and killed all the male children who were in Bethlehem and in all the surrounding countryside, from two years old and under, according to the exact time which he had learned from the wise men.

17.english: Then that which was spoken by Jeremiah the prophet was fulfilled, saying,
17.wedau: maratagogi raketana aiyai  [spoken] au [jeremiah]  peroveta  ririweiya riwa ipa

18.english: “A voice was heard in Ramah, lamentation, weeping and great mourning, Rachel weeping for her children; she wouldn’t be comforted, because they are no more.”
18.wedau: [“a] ponana  [heard] au [ramah] [lamentation] [weeping] ma ghe vavahagha nuwanuwaboyei [rachel] [weeping] yamna ana [children;] tauna [wouldn’t]  paꞌini yamna tauhi  egha [more”]

19.english: But when Herod was dead, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt, saying,

21.english: He arose and took the young child and his mother, and came into the land of Israel.
21.wedau: tauna [arose] ma varahai  [young] ghoraghora ma ana hinana ma neꞌi au  [land] ana [israel]

22.english: But when he heard that Archelaus was reigning over Judea in the place of his father, Herod, he was afraid to go there. Being warned in a dream, he withdrew into the region of Galilee,
22.wedau: tuna maranaina tauna [heard] raketana [archelaus]  [reigning] au judiya au  gabu ana ana Tamatei [herod] tauna  [afraid] da nae kampa  [warned] au  [dream] tauna [withdrew] au  [region] ana galili

1.english: In those days, John the Baptizer came, preaching in the wilderness of Judea, saying,
1.wedau: au raketana maratom john  [baptizer] neꞌi rau-guguyei au  mutuyuwa ana judiya riwa ipa

2.english: “Repent, for the Kingdom of Heaven is at hand!”
2.wedau: [“repent] yamna  vibadana ana marei  au [hand!”]
2.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Justice (0.80); Strong secondary: Wisdom

3.english: For this is he who was spoken of by Isaiah the prophet, saying, “The voice of one crying in the wilderness, make the way of the Lord ready! Make his paths straight!”

7.english: But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming for his baptism, he said to them, “You offspring of vipers, who warned you to flee from the wrath to come?

9.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Justice (0.63); Strong secondary: Wisdom

10.english: “Even now the ax lies at the root of the trees. Therefore every tree that doesn’t produce good fruit is cut down, and cast into the fire.

11.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.89); Strong secondary: Love

12.english: His winnowing fork is in his hand, and he will thoroughly cleanse his threshing floor. He will gather his wheat into the barn, but the chaff he will burn up with unquenchable fire.”

13.english: Then Jesus came from Galilee to the Jordan to John, to be baptized by him.
13.wedau: maratagogi Yesu neꞌi au galili da  jordan da john da  babataitoi au tauna

14.english: But John would have hindered him, saying, “I need to be baptized by you, and you come to me?”

15.english: But Jesus, answering, said to him, “Allow it now, for this is the fitting way for us to fulfill all righteousness.” Then he allowed him.

16.english: Jesus, when he was baptized, went up directly from the water: and behold, the heavens were opened to him. He saw the Spirit of God descending as a dove, and coming on him.

17.english: Behold, a voice out of the heavens said, “This is my beloved Son, with whom I am well pleased.”

1.english: Then Jesus was led up by the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted by the devil.

6.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.78); Strong secondary: Love

7.english: Jesus said to him, “Again, it is written, ‘You shall not test the Lord, your God.’ ”

7.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.85); Strong secondary: Love

8.english: Again, the devil took him to an exceedingly high mountain, and showed him all the kingdoms of the world, and their glory.

20.english: but lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust consume, and where thieves don’t break through and steal;

21.english: for where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.
21.wedau: yamna aiwaꞌi ami [treasure]  kampa ami urana ina  maitehi

22.english: “The lamp of the body is the eye. If therefore your eye is sound, your whole body will be full of light.

23.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.50); Low harmony verse (distinctive emphasis)

24.english: “No one can serve two masters, for either he will hate the one and love the other; or else he will be devoted to one and despise the other. You can’t serve both God and Mammon.

24.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.69); Strong secondary: Love

25.english: Therefore I tell you, don’t be anxious for your life: what you will eat, or what you will drink; nor yet for your body, what you will wear. Isn’t life more than food, and the body more than clothing?

26.english: See the birds of the sky, that they don’t sow, neither do they reap, nor gather into barns. Your heavenly Father feeds them. Aren’t you of much more value than they?

27.wedau: [“which] ana omi au  [anxious] ita [add] [one] [moment] da ana [lifespan?]

28.english: Why are you anxious about clothing? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow. They don’t toil, neither do they spin,

29.wedau: [yet] tau riwehi omi raketana ma [solomon] au anatapuhi ana [glory]  egha [dressed] [like] [one] ana ina

30.english: But if God so clothes the grass of the field, which today exists, and tomorrow is thrown into the oven, won’t he much more clothe you, you of little faith?

30.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.64); Strong secondary: Love

31.english: “Therefore don’t be anxious, saying, ‘What will we eat?’, ‘What will we drink?’ or, ‘With what will we be clothed?’

34.english: Therefore don’t be anxious for tomorrow, for tomorrow will be anxious for itself. Each day’s own evil is sufficient.

1.english: “Don’t judge, so that you won’t be judged.

2.english: For with whatever judgment you judge, you will be judged; and with whatever measure you measure, it will be measured to you.

4.english: Or how will you tell your brother, ‘Let me remove the speck from your eye;’ and behold, the beam is in your own eye?

5.english: You hypocrite! First remove the beam out of your own eye, and then you can see clearly to remove the speck out of your brother’s eye.

8.english: For everyone who asks receives. He who seeks finds. To him who knocks it will be opened.
8.wedau: yamna anatapuhi aiyai rau-baghei [receives] tauna aiyai [seeks] [finds] da tauna aiyai [knocks] tauna ina  wana-tawaneꞌi

9.english: Or who is there among you, who, if his son asks him for bread, will give him a stone?

10.english: Or if he asks for a fish, who will give him a serpent?
10.wedau: bo tora tauna rau-baghei yamna  [fish] aiyai ina verei tauna  [serpent?]

12.wedau: [therefore] [whatever] omi [desire] yamna rava da rura da omi omi ina maitehi rura da [them;] yamna ina   [law] ma  peroveta

13.english: “Enter in by the narrow gate; for wide is the gate and broad is the way that leads to destruction, and many are those who enter in by it.
13.wedau: [“enter] au au  [narrow] [gate;] yamna [wide]   [gate] ma [broad]   parata raketana [leads] da [destruction] ma anatapuhi  raketana aiyai rui au au tauna

14.english: How narrow is the gate, and restricted is the way that leads to life! Few are those who find it.
14.wedau: aiwaꞌi [narrow]   [gate] ma [restricted]   parata raketana [leads] da [life!] ghehauhi  raketana aiyai [find] tauna

17.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Power (0.50); Low harmony verse (distinctive emphasis)

18.english: A good tree can’t produce evil fruit, neither can a corrupt tree produce good fruit.

19.english: Every tree that doesn’t grow good fruit is cut down, and thrown into the fire.

21.english: Not everyone who says to me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ will enter into the Kingdom of Heaven; but he who does the will of my Father who is in heaven.

22.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.75); Strong secondary: Love

27.english: The rain came down, the floods came, and the winds blew, and beat on that house; and it fell—and great was its fall.”

29.english: for he taught them with authority, and not like the scribes.

1.english: When he came down from the mountain, great multitudes followed him.

26.english: He said to them, “Why are you fearful, O you of little faith?” Then he got up, rebuked the wind and the sea, and there was a great calm.

27.english: The men marveled, saying, “What kind of man is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?”

29.english: Behold, they cried out, saying, “What do we have to do with you, Jesus, Son of God? Have you come here to torment us before the time?”

29.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.84); Strong secondary: Love

32.english: He said to them, “Go!” They came out, and went into the herd of pigs: and behold, the whole herd of pigs rushed down the cliff into the sea, and died in the water.

34.english: Behold, all the city came out to meet Jesus. When they saw him, they begged that he would depart from their borders.

1.english: He entered into a boat, and crossed over, and came into his own city.

2.english: Behold, they brought to him a man who was paralyzed, lying on a bed. Jesus, seeing their faith, said to the paralytic, “Son, cheer up! Your sins are forgiven you.”

8.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.70); Strong secondary: Love

17.wedau: [neither] rura rava terei vouna [wine] au [old] [wine] [skins] bo [else]  [skins] ina [burst] ma  [wine]  [spilled] ma  [skins] [ruined] egha tauhi terei vouna [wine] au [fresh] [wine] [skins] ma ruwagha  [preserved”]

18.english: While he told these things to them, behold, a ruler came and worshiped him, saying, “My daughter has just died, but come and lay your hand on her, and she will live.”

23.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.85); Strong secondary: Love

28.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.74); Strong secondary: Love

35.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Power (0.85); Strong secondary: Justice

1.english: He called to himself his twelve disciples, and gave them authority over unclean spirits, to cast them out, and to heal every disease and every sickness.
1.wedau: tauna ghorehi da [himself] ana [twelve] tauvotaghotagho ma verei hita rewapana au apoapoena aruwa da [cast] hita hopu ma da [heal] anatapuhi [disease] ma anatapuhi [sickness]

2.english: Now the names of the twelve apostles are these. The first, Simon, who is called Peter; Andrew, his brother; James the son of Zebedee; John, his brother;

3.english: Philip; Bartholomew; Thomas; Matthew the tax collector; James the son of Alphaeus; Lebbaeus, who was also called Thaddaeus;
3.wedau: [philip;] [bartholomew;] [thomas;] [matthew]  [tax] [collector;] james  natuna ana [alphaeus;] [lebbaeus] aiyai  maitehi ghorehi [thaddaeus;]

7.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Justice (0.77); Strong secondary: Wisdom

8.english: Heal the sick, cleanse the lepers, and cast out demons. Freely you received, so freely give.

9.english: Don’t take any gold, silver, or brass in your money belts.

10.english: Take no bag for your journey, neither two coats, nor sandals, nor staff: for the laborer is worthy of his food.

11.english: Into whatever city or village you enter, find out who in it is worthy; and stay there until you go on.

12.wedau: omi rui au  [household] [greet] tauna

13.english: If the household is worthy, let your peace come on it, but if it isn’t worthy, let your peace return to you.

14.english: Whoever doesn’t receive you, nor hear your words, as you go out of that house or that city, shake the dust off your feet.
14.wedau: [whoever] [doesn’t] [receive] omi [nor] [hear] ami riwehi  omi nae hopu ana raketana numa bo raketana meyagaihi [shake]  [dust] [off] ami [feet]

15.english: Most certainly I tell you, it will be more tolerable for the land of Sodom and Gomorrah in the day of judgment than for that city.
15.wedau: anatapuhi [certainly] tau riwehi omi tauna ina  ghe vavahagha [tolerable] yamna  [land] ana [sodom] ma [gomorrah] au  mara ana [judgment] da yamna raketana meyagaihi

16.english: “Behold, I send you out as sheep among wolves. Therefore be wise as serpents, and harmless as doves.
16.wedau: [“behold] tau vivohi omi hopu  [sheep] [among] [wolves] [therefore]  [wise]  [serpents] ma [harmless]  gabubu

18.wedau: [yes] ma omi ina  neiyahi naona [governors] ma kingi yamna au [sake] yamna  inavi heghehi da hita ma da  [nations]

19.english: But when they deliver you up, don’t be anxious how or what you will say, for it will be given you in that hour what you will say.
19.wedau: tuna maranaina tauhi [deliver] omi au [don’t]  [anxious] aiwaꞌi bo aiwaꞌi omi ina riwa yamna tauna ina  verei omi au raketana [hour] aiwaꞌi omi ina riwa

20.english: For it is not you who speak, but the Spirit of your Father who speaks in you.
20.wedau: yamna tauna  egha omi aiyai pa tuna  aruwa ana ami Tamatei aiyai pa au omi

21.english: “Brother will deliver up brother to death, and the father his child. Children will rise up against parents, and cause them to be put to death.
21.wedau: [“brother] ina [deliver] au tevera da mate ma  Tamatei ana ghoraghora natunatuna ina [rise] au awarina [parents] ma [cause] hita da  terei da mate

22.english: You will be hated by all men for my name’s sake, but he who endures to the end will be saved.
22.wedau: omi ina  [hated] au anatapuhi rava yamna au [name’s] [sake] tuna tauna aiyai [endures] da  [end] ina  [saved]

23.english: But when they persecute you in this city, flee into the next, for most certainly I tell you, you will not have gone through the cities of Israel until the Son of Man has come.
23.wedau: tuna maranaina tauhi [persecute] omi au ina meyagaihi [flee] au  [next] yamna anatapuhi [certainly] tau riwehi omi omi ina egha ana nae au  [cities] ana [israel] [until]  natuna ana oroto ana neꞌi

24.english: “A disciple is not above his teacher, nor a servant above his lord.
24.wedau: [“a] [disciple]  egha [above] ana [teacher] [nor]  [servant] [above] ana Guyau
24.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.73); Strong secondary: Love

25.english: It is enough for the disciple that he be like his teacher, and the servant like his lord. If they have called the master of the house Beelzebul, how much more those of his household!
25.wedau: tauna  [enough] yamna  [disciple] raketana tauna  [like] ana [teacher] ma  [servant] [like] ana Guyau tora tauhi ana ghorehi  [master] ana  numa [beelzebul] aiwaꞌi [much] ghe vavahagha raketana ana ana [household!]
25.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.70); Strong secondary: Love

26.english: Therefore don’t be afraid of them, for there is nothing covered that will not be revealed; and hidden that will not be known.
26.wedau: [therefore] [don’t]  [afraid] ana hita yamna kampa  [nothing] [covered] raketana ina egha  [revealed;] ma [hidden] raketana ina egha  haramaneꞌi

27.english: What I tell you in the darkness, speak in the light; and what you hear whispered in the ear, proclaim on the housetops.
27.wedau: aiwaꞌi tau riwehi omi au  [darkness] pa au  [light;] ma aiwaꞌi omi [hear] [whispered] au  [ear] [proclaim] au  [housetops]

28.english: Don’t be afraid of those who kill the body, but are not able to kill the soul. Rather, fear him who is able to destroy both soul and body in Gehenna.
28.wedau: [don’t]  [afraid] ana raketana aiyai [kill]  [body] tuna  egha [able] da [kill]  [soul] [rather] [fear] tauna aiyai  [able] da rau-iviꞌapoapoyeꞌai ruwagha [soul] ma [body] au [gehenna]

29.english: “Aren’t two sparrows sold for an assarion coin? Not one of them falls on the ground apart from your Father’s will,
29.wedau: [“aren’t] [two] [sparrows] [sold] yamna [an] [assarion] [coin?] egha [one] ana hita [falls] au  [ground] [apart] au ami [father’s] ina

30.english: but the very hairs of your head are all numbered.
30.wedau: tuna  ghe aparana ana ami [head]  anatapuhi [numbered]

31.english: Therefore don’t be afraid. You are of more value than many sparrows.
31.wedau: [therefore] [don’t]  [afraid] omi  ana ghe vavahagha [value] da anatapuhi [sparrows]

32.english: Everyone therefore who confesses me before men, I will also confess him before my Father who is in heaven.
32.wedau: anatapuhi [therefore] aiyai [confesses] tau naona rava tau ina maitehi [confess] tauna naona au Tamatei aiyai  au marei

33.english: But whoever denies me before men, I will also deny him before my Father who is in heaven.
33.wedau: tuna [whoever] [denies] tau naona rava tau ina maitehi [deny] tauna naona au Tamatei aiyai  au marei

34.english: “Don’t think that I came to send peace on the earth. I didn’t come to send peace, but a sword.
34.wedau: [“don’t] [think] raketana tau neꞌi da vivohi [peace] au  dobuna tau [didn’t] neꞌi da vivohi [peace] tuna  [sword]

35.english: For I came to set a man at odds against his father, and a daughter against her mother, and a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.
35.wedau: yamna tau neꞌi da [set]  oroto au [odds] awarina ana Tamatei ma  natuna awarina ana hinana ma  [daughter-in-law] awarina ana pohiyana

36.english: A man’s foes will be those of his own household.

37.english: He who loves father or mother more than me is not worthy of me; and he who loves son or daughter more than me isn’t worthy of me.
37.wedau: tauna aiyai [loves] Tamatei bo hinana ghe vavahagha da tau  egha tagotagogiu ana [me;] ma tauna aiyai [loves] natuna bo natuna ghe vavahagha da tau [isn’t] tagotagogiu ana tau

38.english: He who doesn’t take his cross and follow after me, isn’t worthy of me.
38.wedau: tauna aiyai [doesn’t] varahai ana [cross] ma votaghou muriyai tau [isn’t] tagotagogiu ana tau

39.english: He who seeks his life will lose it; and he who loses his life for my sake will find it.
39.wedau: tauna aiyai [seeks] ana yawahana ina [lose] [it;] ma tauna aiyai [loses] ana yawahana yamna au [sake] ina [find] tauna

40.english: He who receives you receives me, and he who receives me receives him who sent me.
40.wedau: tauna aiyai [receives] omi [receives] tau ma tauna aiyai [receives] tau [receives] tauna aiyai vivohi tau

41.english: He who receives a prophet in the name of a prophet will receive a prophet’s reward. He who receives a righteous man in the name of a righteous man will receive a righteous man’s reward.
41.wedau: tauna aiyai [receives]  peroveta au  wava ana  peroveta ina [receive]  [prophet’s] puyona tauna aiyai [receives]  [righteous] oroto au  wava ana  [righteous] oroto ina [receive]  [righteous] [man’s] puyona
41.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Justice (0.71); Strong secondary: Wisdom

42.english: Whoever gives one of these little ones just a cup of cold water to drink in the name of a disciple, most certainly I tell you he will in no way lose his reward.”
42.wedau: [whoever] verei [one] ana ina [little] au tagotagogi  [cup] ana [cold] waira da [drink] au  wava ana  [disciple] anatapuhi [certainly] tau riwehi omi tauna ina au egha parata [lose] ana [reward”]
42.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.61); Strong secondary: Justice

1.english: When Jesus had finished directing his twelve disciples, he departed from there to teach and preach in their cities.

1.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.77); Strong secondary: Love

2.english: Now when John heard in the prison the works of Christ, he sent two of his disciples

3.english: and said to him, “Are you he who comes, or should we look for another?”
3.wedau: ma riwa da tauna [“are] omi tauna aiyai neꞌi bo ina ita [look] yamna [another?”]

4.english: Jesus answered them, “Go and tell John the things which you hear and see:

7.english: As these went their way, Jesus began to say to the multitudes concerning John, “What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?

8.english: But what did you go out to see? A man in soft clothing? Behold, those who wear soft clothing are in kings’ houses.

9.english: But why did you go out? To see a prophet? Yes, I tell you, and much more than a prophet.

11.english: Most certainly I tell you, among those who are born of women there has not arisen anyone greater than John the Baptizer; yet he who is least in the Kingdom of Heaven is greater than he.

12.english: From the days of John the Baptizer until now, the Kingdom of Heaven suffers violence, and the violent take it by force.

12.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Power (0.89); Strong secondary: Justice

13.english: For all the prophets and the law prophesied until John.
13.wedau: yamna anatapuhi  peroveta ma  [law] [prophesied] [until] john

14.english: If you are willing to receive it, this is Elijah, who is to come.

15.english: He who has ears to hear, let him hear.
15.wedau: tauna aiyai ana [ears] da [hear] ita tauna [hear]

16.english: “But to what shall I compare this generation? It is like children sitting in the marketplaces, who call to their companions

17.english: and say, ‘We played the flute for you, and you didn’t dance. We mourned for you, and you didn’t lament.’
17.wedau: ma riwa [‘we] [played]  [flute] yamna omi ma omi [didn’t] [dance] ita nuwanuwaboyei yamna omi ma omi [didn’t] [lament’]

19.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Power (0.82); Strong secondary: Justice

20.english: Then he began to denounce the cities in which most of his mighty works had been done, because they didn’t repent.

21.english: “Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the mighty works had been done in Tyre and Sidon which were done in you, they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes.
21.wedau: [“woe] da omi [chorazin!] [woe] da omi [bethsaida!] yamna tora  [mighty] [works] ana  [done] au [tyre] ma [sidon] aiyai  [done] au omi tauhi ina ana wanavira-meyemi [long] [ago] au [sackcloth] ma [ashes]

22.wedau: tuna tau riwehi omi tauna ina  ghe vavahagha [tolerable] yamna [tyre] ma [sidon] au  mara ana [judgment] da yamna omi

23.english: You, Capernaum, who are exalted to heaven, you will go down to Hades. For if the mighty works had been done in Sodom which were done in you, it would have remained until today.
23.wedau: omi kapernaum aiyai  [exalted] da marei omi ina nae au da ana yamna tora  [mighty] [works] ana  [done] au [sodom] aiyai  [done] au omi tauna ina ana [remained] [until] [today]

24.english: But I tell you that it will be more tolerable for the land of Sodom, on the day of judgment, than for you.”

25.english: At that time, Jesus answered, “I thank you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that you hid these things from the wise and understanding, and revealed them to infants.
25.wedau: au raketana mara Yesu [answered] [“i] [thank] omi Tamatei Guyau ana marei ma dobuna raketana omi [hid] ina [things] au  [wise] ma [understanding] ma [revealed] hita da [infants]
25.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.85); Strong secondary: Love

26.english: Yes, Father, for so it was well-pleasing in your sight.
26.wedau: [yes] Tamatei yamna yamna tauna  [well-pleasing] au ami [sight]
26.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Power (0.50); Low harmony verse (distinctive emphasis)

27.english: All things have been delivered to me by my Father. No one knows the Son, except the Father; neither does anyone know the Father, except the Son, and he to whom the Son desires to reveal him.
27.wedau: anatapuhi [things] ana  [delivered] da tau au au Tamatei egha [one] haramaneꞌi  natuna [except]  [father;] [neither] rura [anyone] haramaneꞌi  Tamatei [except]  natuna ma tauna da aiyai  natuna [desires] da [reveal] tauna

28.english: “Come to me, all you who labor and are heavily burdened, and I will give you rest.
28.wedau: [“come] da tau anatapuhi omi aiyai [labor] ma  [heavily] [burdened] ma tau ina verei omi [rest]

29.english: Take my yoke upon you, and learn from me, for I am gentle and humble in heart; and you will find rest for your souls.
29.wedau: varahai au [yoke] [upon] omi ma [learn] au tau yamna tau [am] [gentle] ma [humble] au [heart;] ma omi ina [find] [rest] yamna ami [souls]
29.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.75); Strong secondary: Justice

30.english: For my yoke is easy, and my burden is light.”
30.wedau: yamna au [yoke]  [easy] ma au [burden]  [light”]

1.english: At that time, Jesus went on the Sabbath day through the grain fields. His disciples were hungry and began to pluck heads of grain and to eat.
1.wedau: au raketana mara Yesu nae au  sabate mara au  [grain] [fields] ana tauvotaghotagho  [hungry] ma [began] da [pluck] [heads] ana [grain] ma da [eat]

2.wedau: tuna  [pharisees] maranaina tauhi inana tauna riwa da tauna [“behold] ami tauvotaghotagho rura aiwaꞌi  egha [lawful] da rura au  [sabbath”]

3.english: But he said to them, “Haven’t you read what David did, when he was hungry, and those who were with him;

4.english: how he entered into God’s house, and ate the show bread, which was not lawful for him to eat, neither for those who were with him, but only for the priests?
4.wedau: aiwaꞌi tauna rui au [god’s] numa ma [ate]  atataiyana [bread] aiyai  egha [lawful] yamna tauna da [eat] [neither] yamna raketana aiyai  maitehi tauna tuna tagotagogi yamna  [priests?]
4.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.74); Strong secondary: Love

5.english: Or have you not read in the law, that on the Sabbath day, the priests in the temple profane the Sabbath, and are guiltless?

5.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Justice (0.63); Strong secondary: Wisdom

6.english: But I tell you that one greater than the temple is here.
6.wedau: tuna tau riwehi omi raketana [one] [greater] da  [temple]  ina

7.english: But if you had known what this means, ‘I desire mercy, and not sacrifice,’ you wouldn’t have condemned the guiltless.
7.wedau: tuna tora omi ana haramaneꞌi aiwaꞌi ina [means] [‘i] [desire] nuwaboyei ma egha [sacrifice’] omi [wouldn’t] ana [condemned]  [guiltless]

8.english: For the Son of Man is Lord of the Sabbath.”
8.wedau: yamna  natuna ana oroto  Guyau ana  [sabbath”]

9.english: He departed from there, and went into their synagogue.
9.wedau: tauna [departed] au kampa ma nae au ahi pari numana

10.english: And behold there was a man with a withered hand. They asked him, “Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath day?” that they might accuse him.
10.wedau: ma [behold] kampa   oroto maitehi  [withered] nimana tauhi rau-baghei tauna [“is] tauna [lawful] da [heal] au  sabate [day?”] raketana tauhi ita [accuse] tauna
10.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Power (0.70); Strong secondary: Justice

11.english: He said to them, “What man is there among you, who has one sheep, and if this one falls into a pit on the Sabbath day, won’t he grab on to it, and lift it out?

12.english: Of how much more value then is a man than a sheep! Therefore it is lawful to do good on the Sabbath day.”
12.wedau: ana aiwaꞌi [much] ghe vavahagha [value] maratagogi   oroto da  [sheep!] [therefore] tauna  [lawful] da rura [good] au  sabate [day”]

13.english: Then he told the man, “Stretch out your hand.” He stretched it out; and it was restored whole, just like the other.

22.english: Then one possessed by a demon, blind and mute, was brought to him and he healed him, so that the blind and mute man both spoke and saw.

28.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.81); Strong secondary: Love

29.english: Or how can one enter into the house of the strong man, and plunder his goods, unless he first bind the strong man? Then he will plunder his house.

30.english: “He who is not with me is against me, and he who doesn’t gather with me, scatters.

39.english: But he answered them, “An evil and adulterous generation seeks after a sign, but no sign will be given to it but the sign of Jonah the prophet.

39.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Power (0.50); Low harmony verse (distinctive emphasis)

42.english: The Queen of the South will rise up in the judgment with this generation, and will condemn it, for she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and behold, someone greater than Solomon is here.

1.english: After six days, Jesus took with him Peter, James, and John his brother, and brought them up into a high mountain by themselves.
1.wedau: muriyai [six] maratom Yesu varahai maitehi tauna [peter] james ma john ana tevera ma neiyahi hita au au  [high] dobuna au [themselves]

2.english: He was changed before them. His face shone like the sun, and his garments became as white as the light.
2.wedau: tauna  [changed] naona hita ana [face] [shone] [like]  [sun] ma ana [garments] [became]  [white]   [light]

3.english: Behold, Moses and Elijah appeared to them talking with him.
3.wedau: [behold] moses ma [elijah] [appeared] da hita [talking] maitehi tauna

4.english: Peter answered, and said to Jesus, “Lord, it is good for us to be here. If you want, let’s make three tents here: one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”
4.wedau: [peter] [answered] ma riwa da Yesu [“lord] tauna  [good] yamna ita da  ina tora omi [want] [let’s] rura [three] [tents] [here:] [one] yamna omi [one] yamna moses ma [one] yamna [elijah”]
4.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.73); Strong secondary: Love

5.english: While he was still speaking, behold, a bright cloud overshadowed them. Behold, a voice came out of the cloud, saying, “This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased. Listen to him.”
5.wedau: I [while] tauna  [still] pa [behold]  [bright] [cloud] [overshadowed] hita [behold]  ponana neꞌi hopu ana  [cloud] riwa ipa [“this]  au [beloved] natuna au aiyai tau [am] ahiahina nuwa-ahiahiniu [listen] da [him”]
5.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Power (0.80); Strong secondary: Justice

6.english: When the disciples heard it, they fell on their faces, and were very afraid.
6.wedau: maranaina  tauvotaghotagho [heard] tauna tauhi [fell] au ahi [faces] ma  ghe [afraid]

7.english: Jesus came and touched them and said, “Get up, and don’t be afraid.”
7.wedau: Yesu neꞌi ma dodani hita ma riwa [“get] au ma [don’t]  [afraid”]

8.english: Lifting up their eyes, they saw no one, except Jesus alone.
8.wedau: [lifting] au ahi [eyes] tauhi inana egha [one] [except] Yesu [alone]

9.english: As they were coming down from the mountain, Jesus commanded them, saying, “Don’t tell anyone what you saw, until the Son of Man has risen from the dead.”
9.wedau: tauhi  naenae au au  dobuna Yesu ririweiya hita riwa ipa [“don’t] riwehi [anyone] aiwaꞌi omi inana [until]  natuna ana oroto ana [risen] au  [dead”]

10.english: His disciples asked him, saying, “Then why do the scribes say that Elijah must come first?”
10.wedau: ana tauvotaghotagho rau-baghei tauna riwa ipa [“then] yamna rura  tauviharaharamanahi riwa raketana [elijah] ina neꞌi [first?”]

11.english: Jesus answered them, “Elijah indeed comes first, and will restore all things,
11.wedau: Yesu [answered] hita [“elijah] [indeed] neꞌi naona ma ina [restore] anatapuhi [things]

12.english: but I tell you that Elijah has come already, and they didn’t recognize him, but did to him whatever they wanted to. Even so the Son of Man will also suffer by them.”
12.wedau: tuna tau riwehi omi raketana [elijah] ana neꞌi [already] ma tauhi [didn’t] [recognize] tauna tuna rura da tauna [whatever] tauhi [wanted] da ma yamna  natuna ana oroto ina maitehi [suffer] au [them”]

13.english: Then the disciples understood that he spoke to them of John the Baptizer.
13.wedau: maratagogi  tauvotaghotagho [understood] raketana tauna [spoke] da hita ana john  [baptizer]

14.english: When they came to the multitude, a man came to him, kneeling down to him, and saying,
14.wedau: maranaina tauhi neꞌi da  [multitude]  oroto neꞌi da tauna peꞌu au da tauna ma riwa ipa

15.english: “Lord, have mercy on my son, for he is epileptic, and suffers grievously; for he often falls into the fire, and often into the water.
15.wedau: [“lord] ana nuwaboyei au au natuna yamna tauna  [epileptic] ma [suffers] [grievously;] yamna tauna [often] [falls] au  [fire] ma [often] au  waira
15.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.71); Strong secondary: Love

16.english: So I brought him to your disciples, and they could not cure him.”
16.wedau: yamna tau neiyahi tauna da ami tauvotaghotagho ma tauhi ita egha [cure] [him”]

17.english: Jesus answered, “Faithless and perverse generation! How long will I be with you? How long will I bear with you? Bring him here to me.”
17.wedau: Yesu [answered] [“faithless] ma [perverse] [generation!] aiwaꞌi [long] ina tau  maitehi [you?] aiwaꞌi [long] ina tau [bear] maitehi [you?] [bring] tauna ina da [me”]
17.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.63); Strong secondary: Love

18.english: Jesus rebuked him, the demon went out of him, and the boy was cured from that hour.
18.wedau: Yesu rau-gamopotai tauna  [demon] nae hopu ana tauna ma  [boy]  [cured] au raketana [hour]

19.english: Then the disciples came to Jesus privately, and said, “Why weren’t we able to cast it out?”
19.wedau: maratagogi  tauvotaghotagho neꞌi da Yesu [privately] ma riwa [“why] [weren’t] ita [able] da [cast] tauna [out?”]

20.english: He said to them, “Because of your unbelief. For most certainly I tell you, if you have faith as a grain of mustard seed, you will tell this mountain, ‘Move from here to there,’ and it will move; and nothing will be impossible for you.
20.wedau: tauna riwa da hita [“because] ana ami [unbelief] yamna anatapuhi [certainly] tau riwehi omi tora omi ana [faith]   [grain] ana [mustard] [seed] omi ina riwehi ina dobuna [‘move] au ina da [there’] ma tauna ina [move;] ma [nothing] ina  [impossible] yamna omi

21.english: But this kind doesn’t go out except by prayer and fasting.”
21.wedau: tuna ina [kind] [doesn’t] nae hopu [except] au [prayer] ma [fasting”]

22.english: While they were staying in Galilee, Jesus said to them, “The Son of Man is about to be delivered up into the hands of men,
22.wedau: [while] tauhi  [staying] au galili Yesu riwa da hita [“the] natuna ana oroto  awarina da  [delivered] au au  nimana ana rava

23.english: and they will kill him, and the third day he will be raised up.” They were exceedingly sorry.
23.wedau: ma tauhi ina [kill] tauna ma  [third] mara tauna ina  [raised] [up”] tauhi  [exceedingly] [sorry]

24.english: When they had come to Capernaum, those who collected the didrachma coins came to Peter, and said, “Doesn’t your teacher pay the didrachma?”
24.wedau: maranaina tauhi ana neꞌi da kapernaum raketana aiyai [collected]  [didrachma] [coins] neꞌi da [peter] ma riwa [“doesn’t] ami [teacher] [pay]  [didrachma?”]

25.english: He said, “Yes.” When he came into the house, Jesus anticipated him, saying, “What do you think, Simon? From whom do the kings of the earth receive toll or tribute? From their children, or from strangers?”
25.wedau: tauna riwa [“yes”] maranaina tauna neꞌi au  numa Yesu [anticipated] tauna riwa ipa [“what] rura omi [think] [simon?] au aiyai rura  kingi ana  dobuna [receive] [toll] bo [tribute?] au ahi natunatuna bo au [strangers?”]
25.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.74); Strong secondary: Love

26.english: Peter said to him, “From strangers.” Jesus said to him, “Therefore the children are exempt.
26.wedau: [peter] riwa da tauna [“from] [strangers”] Yesu riwa da tauna [“therefore]  natunatuna  [exempt]

27.english: But, lest we cause them to stumble, go to the sea, cast a hook, and take up the first fish that comes up. When you have opened its mouth, you will find a stater coin. Take that, and give it to them for me and you.”
27.wedau: tuna [lest] ita [cause] hita da [stumble] nae da  topana [cast]  [hook] ma varahai au  naona [fish] raketana neꞌi au maranaina omi ana wana-tawaneꞌi tauna [mouth] omi ina [find]  [stater] [coin] varahai raketana ma verei tauna da hita yamna tau ma [you”]

1.english: In that hour the disciples came to Jesus, saying, “Who then is greatest in the Kingdom of Heaven?”
1.wedau: I au raketana [hour]  tauvotaghotagho neꞌi da Yesu riwa ipa [“who] maratagogi  [greatest] au  vibadana ana [heaven?”]
1.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Power (0.89); Strong secondary: Justice

2.english: Jesus called a little child to himself, and set him in the middle of them,
2.wedau: Yesu ghorehi  [little] ghoraghora da [himself] ma [set] tauna au  [middle] ana hita

3.english: and said, “Most certainly I tell you, unless you turn, and become as little children, you will in no way enter into the Kingdom of Heaven.
3.wedau: ma riwa [“most] [certainly] tau riwehi omi [unless] omi [turn] ma [become]  [little] natunatuna omi ina au egha parata rui au  vibadana ana marei
3.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Justice (0.78); Strong secondary: Wisdom

4.english: Whoever therefore humbles himself as this little child is the greatest in the Kingdom of Heaven.
4.wedau: [whoever] [therefore] [humbles] [himself]  ina [little] ghoraghora   [greatest] au  vibadana ana marei
4.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.83); Strong secondary: Justice

5.english: Whoever receives one such little child in my name receives me,
5.wedau: [whoever] [receives] [one] [such] [little] ghoraghora au au wava [receives] tau

6.english: but whoever causes one of these little ones who believe in me to stumble, it would be better for him if a huge millstone were hung around his neck, and that he were sunk in the depths of the sea.
6.wedau: tuna [whoever] [causes] [one] ana ina [little] au aiyai tumaghanei au tau da [stumble] tauna ina  [better] yamna tauna tora  [huge] [millstone]  [hung] [around] ana [neck] ma raketana tauna  [sunk] au  [depths] ana  topana

7.english: “Woe to the world because of occasions of stumbling! For it must be that the occasions come, but woe to that person through whom the occasion comes!
7.wedau: [“woe] da  dobuna yamna ana [occasions] ana [stumbling!] yamna tauna ina  raketana  [occasions] neꞌi tuna [woe] da raketana [person] au aiyai  [occasion] [comes!]

8.english: If your hand or your foot causes you to stumble, cut it off, and cast it from you. It is better for you to enter into life maimed or crippled, rather than having two hands or two feet to be cast into the eternal fire.
8.wedau: tora ami nimana bo ami [foot] [causes] omi da [stumble] [cut] tauna [off] ma [cast] tauna au omi tauna  [better] yamna omi da rui au yawahana [maimed] bo [crippled] [rather] da [having] [two] nimana bo [two] [feet] da  [cast] au  [eternal] [fire]

9.english: If your eye causes you to stumble, pluck it out, and cast it from you. It is better for you to enter into life with one eye, rather than having two eyes to be cast into the Gehenna of fire.
9.wedau: tora ami [eye] [causes] omi da [stumble] [pluck] tauna hopu ma [cast] tauna au omi tauna  [better] yamna omi da rui au yawahana maitehi [one] [eye] [rather] da [having] [two] [eyes] da  [cast] au  [gehenna] ana [fire]

10.english: See that you don’t despise one of these little ones, for I tell you that in heaven their angels always see the face of my Father who is in heaven.
10.wedau: inana raketana omi [don’t] [despise] [one] ana ina [little] au yamna tau riwehi omi raketana au marei ahi aneya [always] inana  [face] ana au Tamatei aiyai  au marei

11.english: For the Son of Man came to save that which was lost.
11.wedau: yamna  natuna ana oroto neꞌi da [save] raketana aiyai  [lost]

12.english: “What do you think? If a man has one hundred sheep, and one of them goes astray, doesn’t he leave the ninety-nine, go to the mountains, and seek that which has gone astray?
12.wedau: [“what] rura omi [think?] tora  oroto ana [one] [hundred] [sheep] ma [one] ana hita nae [astray] [doesn’t] tauna [leave]  [ninety-nine] nae da  dobuna ma [seek] raketana aiyai ana nae [astray?]

13.english: If he finds it, most certainly I tell you, he rejoices over it more than over the ninety-nine which have not gone astray.
13.wedau: tora tauna [finds] tauna anatapuhi [certainly] tau riwehi omi tauna tumaghanei au tauna ghe vavahagha da au  [ninety-nine] aiyai ana egha nae [astray]

14.english: Even so it is not the will of your Father who is in heaven that one of these little ones should perish.
14.wedau: ma yamna tauna  egha  ina ana ami Tamatei aiyai  au marei raketana [one] ana ina [little] au ina [perish]

15.english: “If your brother sins against you, go, show him his fault between you and him alone. If he listens to you, you have gained back your brother.
15.wedau: [“if] ami tevera ghohaꞌapoapoe awarina omi nae atataiyana tauna ana [fault] au omi ma tauna [alone] tora tauna [listens] da omi omi ana [gained] [back] ami tevera
15.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.50); Low harmony verse (distinctive emphasis)

16.english: But if he doesn’t listen, take one or two more with you, that at the mouth of two or three witnesses every word may be established.
16.wedau: tuna tora tauna [doesn’t] [listen] varahai [one] bo [two] ghe vavahagha maitehi omi raketana au  [mouth] ana [two] bo [three] [witnesses] anatapuhi riwana ita  [established]

17.english: If he refuses to listen to them, tell it to the assembly. If he refuses to hear the assembly also, let him be to you as a Gentile or a tax collector.
17.wedau: tora tauna [refuses] da [listen] da hita riwehi tauna da  [assembly] tora tauna [refuses] da [hear]  [assembly] maitehi ita tauna  da omi   [gentile] bo  [tax] [collector]

18.english: Most certainly I tell you, whatever things you bind on earth will have been bound in heaven, and whatever things you release on earth will have been released in heaven.
18.wedau: anatapuhi [certainly] tau riwehi omi [whatever] [things] omi [bind] au dobuna ina ana  [bound] au marei ma [whatever] [things] omi [release] au dobuna ina ana  [released] au marei

19.english: Again, assuredly I tell you, that if two of you will agree on earth concerning anything that they will ask, it will be done for them by my Father who is in heaven.
19.wedau: vouna [assuredly] tau riwehi omi raketana tora [two] ana omi ina [agree] au dobuna [concerning] [anything] raketana tauhi ina rau-baghei tauna ina  [done] yamna hita au au Tamatei aiyai  au marei

20.english: For where two or three are gathered together in my name, there I am in the middle of them.”
20.wedau: yamna aiwaꞌi [two] bo [three]  tagogiyehi [together] au au wava kampa tau [am] au  [middle] ana [them”]

21.english: Then Peter came and said to him, “Lord, how often shall my brother sin against me, and I forgive him? Until seven times?”
21.wedau: maratagogi [peter] neꞌi ma riwa da tauna [“lord] aiwaꞌi [often] ina au tevera [sin] awarina tau ma tau [forgive] [him?] [until] [seven] [times?”]
21.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.75); Strong secondary: Love

22.english: Jesus said to him, “I don’t tell you until seven times, but, until seventy times seven.
22.wedau: Yesu riwa da tauna [“i] [don’t] riwehi omi [until] [seven] mara tuna [until] [seventy] mara [seven]

23.english: Therefore the Kingdom of Heaven is like a certain king, who wanted to reconcile accounts with his servants.
23.wedau: [therefore]  vibadana ana marei  [like]  [certain] kingi aiyai [wanted] da [reconcile] [accounts] maitehi ana taunoya
23.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Justice (0.80); Strong secondary: Wisdom

24.english: When he had begun to reconcile, one was brought to him who owed him ten thousand talents.
24.wedau: maranaina tauna ana [begun] da [reconcile] [one]  neiyahi da tauna aiyai [owed] tauna [ten] [thousand] [talents]

25.english: But because he couldn’t pay, his lord commanded him to be sold, with his wife, his children, and all that he had, and payment to be made.
25.wedau: tuna yamna tauna [couldn’t] [pay] ana Guyau ririweiya tauna da  [sold] maitehi ana [wife] ana natunatuna ma anatapuhi raketana tauna ana ma [payment] da  rura

26.english: The servant therefore fell down and knelt before him, saying, ‘Lord, have patience with me, and I will repay you all!’
26.wedau: [servant] [therefore] [fell] au ma [knelt] naona tauna riwa ipa [‘lord] ana [patience] maitehi tau ma tau ina [repay] omi [all!’]

27.english: The lord of that servant, being moved with compassion, released him, and forgave him the debt.
27.wedau: Guyau ana raketana [servant]  nuwaboyei maitehi [compassion] [released] tauna ma [forgave] tauna  [debt]
27.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.73); Strong secondary: Love

28.english: “But that servant went out, and found one of his fellow servants, who owed him one hundred denarii, and he grabbed him, and took him by the throat, saying, ‘Pay me what you owe!’
28.wedau: [“but] raketana [servant] nae hopu ma tuhaghai [one] ana ana [fellow] taunoya aiyai [owed] tauna [one] [hundred] [denarii] ma tauna [grabbed] tauna ma varahai tauna au  [throat] riwa ipa [‘pay] tau aiwaꞌi omi [owe!’]

29.english: “So his fellow servant fell down at his feet and begged him, saying, ‘Have patience with me, and I will repay you!’
29.wedau: [“so] ana [fellow] [servant] [fell] au au ana [feet] ma [begged] tauna riwa ipa [‘have] [patience] maitehi tau ma tau ina [repay] [you!’]

30.english: He would not, but went and cast him into prison, until he should pay back that which was due.
30.wedau: tauna ina egha tuna nae ma [cast] tauna au deri [until] tauna ina [pay] [back] raketana aiyai  [due]

31.english: So when his fellow servants saw what was done, they were exceedingly sorry, and came and told their lord all that was done.
31.wedau: yamna maranaina ana [fellow] taunoya inana aiwaꞌi  [done] tauhi  [exceedingly] [sorry] ma neꞌi ma riwehi ahi Guyau anatapuhi raketana  [done]

32.english: Then his lord called him in, and said to him, ‘You wicked servant! I forgave you all that debt, because you begged me.
32.wedau: maratagogi ana Guyau ghorehi tauna au ma riwa da tauna [‘you] [wicked] [servant!] tau [forgave] omi anatapuhi raketana [debt] yamna omi [begged] tau

33.english: Shouldn’t you also have had mercy on your fellow servant, even as I had mercy on you?’
33.wedau: [shouldn’t] omi maitehi ana ana nuwaboyei au ami [fellow] [servant] ma  tau ana nuwaboyei au [you?’]

34.english: His lord was angry, and delivered him to the tormentors, until he should pay all that was due to him.
34.wedau: ana Guyau  [angry] ma [delivered] tauna da  [tormentors] [until] tauna ina [pay] anatapuhi raketana  [due] da tauna

35.english: So my heavenly Father will also do to you, if you don’t each forgive your brother from your hearts for his misdeeds.”
35.wedau: yamna au marei Tamatei ina maitehi rura da omi tora omi [don’t] tagotagogi [forgive] ami tevera au ami urana yamna ana [misdeeds”]

1.english: When Jesus had finished these words, he departed from Galilee, and came into the borders of Judea beyond the Jordan.
1.wedau: maranaina Yesu ana [finished] ina riwehi tauna [departed] au galili ma neꞌi au  [borders] ana judiya [beyond]  jordan
1.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.77); Strong secondary: Love

2.english: Great multitudes followed him, and he healed them there.
2.wedau: ghe vavahagha [multitudes] taghotaghoi tauna ma tauna yawahanihi hita kampa

3.english: Pharisees came to him, testing him, and saying, “Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife for any reason?”
3.wedau: [pharisees] neꞌi da tauna [testing] tauna ma riwa ipa [“is] tauna [lawful] yamna  oroto da [divorce] ana [wife] yamna ghehauna [reason?”]
3.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Justice (0.62); Strong secondary: Wisdom

4.english: He answered, “Haven’t you read that he who made them from the beginning made them male and female,
4.wedau: tauna [answered] [“haven’t] omi [read] raketana tauna aiyai rura hita au  weꞌi rura hita [male] ma [female]

5.english: and said, ‘For this cause a man shall leave his father and mother, and shall be joined to his wife; and the two shall become one flesh?’
5.wedau: ma riwa [‘for] ina [cause]  oroto ina [leave] ana Tamatei ma hinana ma ina  [joined] da ana [wife;] ma  [two] ina [become] [one] [flesh?’]

6.english: So that they are no more two, but one flesh. What therefore God has joined together, don’t let man tear apart.”
6.wedau: yamna raketana tauhi  egha ghe vavahagha [two] tuna [one] [flesh] aiwaꞌi [therefore] God ana [joined] [together] [don’t] ita oroto [tear] [apart”]

7.english: They asked him, “Why then did Moses command us to give her a certificate of divorce, and divorce her?”
7.wedau: tauhi rau-baghei tauna [“why] maratagogi rura moses [command] ita da verei ana  [certificate] ana [divorce] ma [divorce] [her?”]

8.english: He said to them, “Moses, because of the hardness of your hearts, allowed you to divorce your wives, but from the beginning it has not been so.
8.wedau: tauna riwa da hita [“moses] yamna ana  [hardness] ana ami urana [allowed] omi da [divorce] ami [wives] tuna au  weꞌi tauna ana egha  yamna

9.english: I tell you that whoever divorces his wife, except for sexual immorality, and marries another, commits adultery; and he who marries her when she is divorced commits adultery.”
9.wedau: tau riwehi omi raketana [whoever] [divorces] ana [wife] [except] yamna [sexual] [immorality] ma [marries] [another] [commits] [adultery;] ma tauna aiyai [marries] ana maranaina tauna  [divorced] [commits] [adultery”]

10.english: His disciples said to him, “If this is the case of the man with his wife, it is not expedient to marry.”
10.wedau: ana tauvotaghotagho riwa da tauna [“if] ina   [case] ana  oroto maitehi ana [wife] tauna  egha [expedient] da [marry”]

11.english: But he said to them, “Not all men can receive this saying, but those to whom it is given.
11.wedau: tuna tauna riwa da hita [“not] anatapuhi rava ita [receive] ina riwa ipa tuna raketana da aiyai tauna  verei

12.english: For there are eunuchs who were born that way from their mother’s womb, and there are eunuchs who were made eunuchs by men; and there are eunuchs who made themselves eunuchs for the Kingdom of Heaven’s sake. He who is able to receive it, let him receive it.”
12.wedau: yamna kampa  [eunuchs] aiyai  [born] raketana parata au ahi [mother’s] [womb] ma kampa  [eunuchs] aiyai  rura [eunuchs] au [men;] ma kampa  [eunuchs] aiyai rura [themselves] [eunuchs] yamna  vibadana ana [heaven’s] [sake] tauna aiyai  [able] da [receive] tauna ita tauna [receive] [it”]
12.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Justice (0.77); Strong secondary: Wisdom

13.english: Then little children were brought to him, that he should lay his hands on them and pray; and the disciples rebuked them.
13.wedau: maratagogi [little] natunatuna  neiyahi da tauna raketana tauna ina [lay] ana nimana au hita ma [pray;] ma  tauvotaghotagho rau-gamopotai hita

14.english: But Jesus said, “Allow the little children, and don’t forbid them to come to me; for the Kingdom of Heaven belongs to ones like these.”
14.wedau: I tuna Yesu riwa [“allow]  [little] natunatuna ma [don’t] [forbid] hita da neꞌi da [me;] yamna  vibadana ana marei [belongs] da au [like] [these”]
14.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Power (0.87); Strong secondary: Justice

15.english: He laid his hands on them, and departed from there.
15.wedau: tauna [laid] ana nimana au hita ma [departed] au kampa

16.english: Behold, one came to him and said, “Good teacher, what good thing shall I do, that I may have eternal life?”
